title: Job Vacancies at Devien Consult Limited
content:
Devien Consult Limited is a human resources consulting firm that is dedicated to providing innovative and effective HR solutions to businesses of all sizes.

We are recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Customer Service Representative

Job Location: Ikotun, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)
Industry: Health & Wellness

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Our client in the health industry is hiring a Customer Service Representative with strong communication and sales skills.
	The ideal candidate will handle customer inquiries, provide product information, and convert leads into sales.


Job Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 1 - 2 years of experience in customer service or sales
	Strong communication and people skills
	Ability to upsell and close sales
	Friendly, professional, and customer-focused
	Must live within or close to Ikotun.


Salary
N120,000 monthly. 

Click here to apply online

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

 

2.) Graphics Designer

Job Location: Mushin, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Create visually appealing designs for digital and print materials (flyers, social media posts, banners, etc.)
	Collaborate with the marketing team to develop engaging content
	Maintain brand consistency in all designs
	Edit images and graphics for various projects.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a B.Sc Degree with 2 - 3 years of experience.
	Proficiency in design tools like Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or CorelDRAW
	A strong portfolio of previous design work
	Good sense of color, layout, and typography
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.


Click here to apply online

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

 

3.) Business Manager

Job Location: Onipanu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a Business Manager to handle daily operations, support the team, and help drive business growth.


Job Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day business activities
	Support staff recruitment, onboarding, and performance reviews
	Oversee expenses, staff salaries, and basic accounting
	Ensure production runs smoothly and meets quality standards
	Organize staff training and development
	Follow up on client payments and manage invoices
	Support basic marketing and customer relations.


Job Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc Degree with 2 - 3 years of experience.
	Strong leadership and coordination skills
	Good knowledge of business operations
	Experience in printing or production is a plus
	Organized, proactive, and detail-oriented
	Comfortable using Microsoft Office and accounting tools.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Click here to apply online

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

 


4.) Business Development Executive

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities within the fire and security systems sector.
	Build and maintain strong client relationships to ensure repeat business and referrals.
	Present, promote, and sell company products and solutions to prospective clients.
	Collaborate with technical teams to deliver solutions that meet client needs.
	Conduct market research to stay updated on industry trends and competitor activities.
	Prepare proposals, quotations, and presentations for clients.


Requirements


	2 to 4 years of experience in business development within the fire and security systems industry.
	Strong knowledge of electrical fire devices, access control systems, CCTV, and related technologies.
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
	Self-motivated, goal-oriented, and able to work independently.
	Strong network within the Lagos region is an added advantage.


Click here to apply online

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Content and Media Manager Job at Soft Nigeria
content:
Soft Nigeria is a premium lifestyle and entertainment media brand that showcases the best of Nigerian luxury, culture, and influence. We also operate a dynamic news blog delivering timely stories in entertainment, celebrity lifestyle, politics, and more.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content and Media Manager
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Work mode: (Hybrid / Remote options available)

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced and highly creative Content & Media Manager to lead the creation, management, and distribution of engaging digital content across Soft Nigeria’s social platforms and news blog.
	The ideal candidate must have a strong background working with established media companies and a proven track record of delivering high-impact content in both lifestyle and news sectors.


Key Responsibilities
Content Development & Strategy:


	Lead the planning, creation, and execution of high-quality visual, written, and video content for all Soft Nigeria platforms.
	Develop and manage a strategic content calendar across social media, YouTube, the news blog, and other digital channels.
	Ensure all content aligns with Soft Nigeria’s brand voice, luxury lifestyle focus, and current digital trends.


Multimedia Production Oversight:


	Oversee the production of visual and video content including interviews, lifestyle features, event coverage, and digital shows.
	Coordinate shoots, scripting, editing, and post-production to maintain broadcast-quality content for digital platforms.
	Uphold professional production standards that reflect the sophistication of Soft Nigeria’s brand.


Social Media Management:


	Manage and grow all Soft Nigeria social media accounts through curated content, timely posting, and strategic engagement.
	Analyze audience insights to refine content strategy and maximize engagement and reach.
	Collaborate with influencers, celebrities, and brand partners to enhance social media presence.


Editorial Leadership:


	Supervise content creation for the Soft Nigeria news blog, ensuring accuracy, originality, and relevance.
	Assign topics, edit submissions, and oversee the publishing of breaking news and long-form features.


Team Collaboration & Leadership:


	Lead and mentor a team of creatives, content writers, videographers, editors, and freelancers.
	Ensure cohesive and timely delivery of multimedia content across platforms.
	Report directly to senior leadership with performance updates, growth strategies, and innovative content ideas.


Requirements


	Minimum 3 years of experience in a content creation, media management, or digital production role.
	Must have prior experience working with established media companies (broadcast, digital, or publishing).
	Deep understanding of content trends, audience engagement strategies, and social media algorithms.
	Strong proficiency in video production, content planning tools, and editing software.
	Excellent writing, editing, and visual storytelling skills.
	Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
	Passion for lifestyle, luxury culture, entertainment, and news.


Why Join Us?


	Be part of a forward-thinking media brand reshaping Nigerian luxury and digital storytelling.
	Work within a creative, ambitious, and collaborative environment.
	Enjoy growth opportunities and the chance to lead content strategy for a rising media powerhouse.


Compensation
N200,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, a short cover letter, and links to samples of their past media work (videos, campaigns, social pages, or articles) to : careers@amogamarketing.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: ICT Officer Job at Staff-Recruit
content:
Staff-Recruit is a leading Human Resource and Management Consulting firm which provides a range of recruitment, selection, outsourcing, training & development solutions. We are a dedicated team of professional consultants offering top of the line executive recruitment and selection services. We cater for the needs of a range of professionals seeking employment and work together to create effective solutions using our networks and strong client base.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: ICT Officer
Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Schedule: Hybrid workmode (3days onsite).

Job Brief
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a skilled ICT Officer to join the Real Estate Sector. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in information technology, with expertise in computer systems, networks, and software applications. This role requires problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and a proactive approach to maintaining and improving our ICT infrastructure.


Responsibilities


	Install, configure, and maintain hardware and software components of our ICT infrastructure, including servers, networks, and peripherals.
	Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues, ensuring timely resolution and minimal downtime.
	Implement and maintain security measures to protect our ICT systems and data from unauthorized access, malware, and other threats.
	Conduct periodic audits and assessments of our ICT environment to identify areas for improvement and optimization.
	Train and mentor staff on ICT best practices, security protocols, and proper use of technology tools and resources.
	Monitor and enforce compliance with ICT policies, standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Manage user accounts, permissions, and access rights, ensuring compliance with security policies and procedures.
	Conduct regular backups and disaster recovery procedures to safeguard critical data and systems.
	Plan and implement ICT projects, upgrades, and migrations, ensuring minimal disruption to business operations.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support business initiatives and projects that require ICT expertise.


Requirements and Qualifications:


	Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field; professional certifications (e.g., CompTIA, Cisco, Microsoft) is an added advantage
	Proven experience, minimum of 5 years in ICT support and administration, with a strong technical background in IT systems and networks.
	Solid understanding of network protocols, security principles, and best practices.
	Proficiency in installing, configuring, and troubleshooting hardware and software components, including servers, routers, switches, and firewalls.
	Experience with virtualization technologies (e.g., VMware, Hyper-V) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) is a plus.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@atcohomes.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: NOC Engineer Job at Willers Solutions Limited
content:
Willers Solutions Limited - Our client, a reputable firm in the internet service providing sector, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: NOC Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	Our client, a reputable firm in the ISP sector, is recruiting for the role of NOC Engineer to join their team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for monitoring and maintaining the performance of network systems, ensuring round-the-clock service availability, and escalating issues when necessary to ensure uninterrupted network operations.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Perform general system administration tasks across all network elements
	Detect and address potential issues affecting system performance or customer satisfaction
	Proactively monitor network and system performance
	Analyze traffic data/trends and escalate concerns to the network design authority
	Escalate unresolved issues to third-level support (Problem Management Team)
	Conduct 24/7 network surveillance and respond to both network- and customer-reported issues
	Take ownership to resolve all issues promptly and efficiently
	Utilize network monitoring/management tools for problem resolution
	Monitor service levels of key suppliers and report SLA breaches


Education & Qualifications


	HND / B.Sc Degree in Computer Engineering, Telecommunications, or related field
	Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
	Solid, fact-based decision-making ability under pressure
	Cisco CCNA/CCNP certification
	Ability to manage Cisco switches
	Ability to thrive in an international, multicultural, and high-pressure environment
	Technical experience in telecom or network operations
	Good understanding of wireless communication technologies
	Willingness to work in a 24/7 shift rotation.


Method of Application
Interested candidates should send their CV to: resource@willerssolutions.com using “NOC Engineer” as the subject of the mail
